intro: Brongniartia ulbrichiana, commonly known as the Ulbrich's brongniartia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
